comment:
This guy found it's way back home from Japan by way of a fellow bourbon brother, fortunate for me!

NOSE: Heavy oak and vanilla extract dominate the nose upfront with a subtle baking spice trying to peak through.

TASTE:  Flat Cola with a spicy honey lead the charge with a hint of orange zest and caramel chews laying in the background.

FINISH: Very bold up front with flavor and light burn the sustains through the sip, fades quickly leaving you wanting another.

 BODY: Light and clean, slightest oil that is gone in a flash, well balanced.

OVERALL: Loved it, even without it being cask strength it still packs a punch with full flavor. Blantons does it again.

As always keep drinking my friends, Skol!
Smooth with a strong Oak finish.
Smooth and complex. A real sipper.
Smooth like the other side of the pillow. Almost drank the whole bottle in one sitting.
So smooth. Could drink this all day. Carmel Apple, amazing finish, consistent and does not disappoint!
Not as good as Gold, or American Single Barrel, but Blantons Black flows like honey in Japan, easy to get and still delicious.
For such a low proof this is phenomenal
Tasting Blanton's Red & Black side by side both are solid, the Black is a little watered down/thin for my taste, but has a nice finish. Definitely prefer the Red.
